alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 11:55AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Laurel, northwestern Owsley, southwestern Estill, Pulaski, Jackson, Rockcastle and southern Lee Counties through 1245 PM EST... At 1155 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Stanford to near Liberty to near Columbia. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Boone, Bee Lick, Quail, Willailla, Ottowa, Bandy, Snider, Disputanta, Conway and Woodstock around 1215 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Spiro, Maretburg, Wabp, Bromo, Faubush, Morrill, Sand Springs, Cains Store, Level Green, Hansford, Mount Vernon, Burr, Nancy, Shirley, Hisel, Wellhope, Flat Rock, Muellersville, Orlando, Kerby Knob, Donaro, Withers, Blanton Flats, Alcorn, Sinks, Pulaski County Park, Jep Hill, Dudley Station, Robinet, Cooksburg, Somerset, Science Hill, Dango, Ardery, Carico, Horse Lick, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Middlefork, Loam, Cruise, Shop Branch, Willow Shoals, Ruth, Dabolt, Yellow Rock, Deese, Hurley, Grade, Parrot, Cornelius, Beattyville, McKee, Atkinstown, Gray Hawk, Bent, Belle Point, Mildred, Olin, Mount Olive and White Ash. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 47 and 72. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County near mile marker 1. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 17 and 40. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for south central, southeastern and east central Kentucky.
